title: Sequoia & Kings Canyon National Parks: Azalea Campground
body: Azalea Campground       Azalea Campground is in the Grant Grove area, 3.5 miles (5.6 km) from Kings Canyon National Park entrance on Hwy 180. The campground is situated under open stands of evergreen trees.      Region   Grant Grove area in Kings Canyon NP     Elevation   6,500 ft. (1,981 m)     Open   Year-round     Reservations   First-come, first-served     Fee   $18/night     Number of sites   110 40 sites available for spring camping     RV/Trailer length   Varies    Hookups None    Generator hours Use them 9 a.m. - 9 p.m. only!     Pets   Permitted (Learn more about pet regulations)     Dump and water station   None. Nearest dump stations (summer only): Dorst Creek Campground in Sequoia National Park, or Princess Campground (Hwy 180 at Hume Lake junction) in Sequoia National Forest     Groceries, showers, laundry   Â½ mile (.8 km) to Grant Grove Village. Coin-operated showers (quarters), summer only     Accessibility   Site #30 is suitable for wheelchairs     Ranger Programs   In summer     Phone   Yes     Restrooms   Flush toilets     Food storage   Large food locker - 47"W x 33"D x 28"H      You are required to store food properly in order to protect bears. Learn more about bears and food storage in the parks.  Download the Azalea Campground map for a larger, printable image. (PDF)
